text: Which artery supplies oxygenated blood to the heart muscle?
explanation: The coronary arteries supply oxygenated blood to the heart muscle (myocardium). They branch off from the aorta just above the aortic valve.

text: What is the most common cause of heart failure?
explanation: Coronary artery disease is the leading cause of heart failure, followed by hypertension. It reduces blood flow to the heart muscle.

text: What is the normal ejection fraction of the left ventricle?
explanation: The normal left ventricular ejection fraction is 50-70%. Values below 40% indicate systolic dysfunction.

text: What does the P wave represent on an ECG?
explanation: The P wave represents atrial depolarization, which occurs when the atria contract to push blood into the ventricles.

text: What is the first-line treatment for stable angina?
explanation: Beta-blockers are the first-line treatment for stable angina as they reduce heart rate and myocardial oxygen demand.
